CatDescriptText: Ted Winston, Alcoa employe, Schenley Heights and Lucille Stockley, cook, Fifth Ward, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, October 29, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think there is too much emphasis placed on sports in high school and college?"  Mr. Winston's answer reads: "I don't think there's too much emphasis on sports...It's the exception and not the rule for schools to pamper an athlete...Throughtout the country, the schools are gradually getting away from treating athletes this way."  Mrs. Stockley's answer reads: "You have to have recreation in the schools...I don't think there's too much emphasis on sports."
TitMainTitle: Two Frames: Portrait of Ted Winston wearing fedora, eyeglasses, and light colored coat, standing on sidewalk in front of store window with sign that reads "5.99"; Portrait of Lucille Stockley wearing eyeglasses, light colored scarf, and dark coat with fur collar, standing on sidewalk in front of street with automobiles
